11331222.content:
The spinosaur's crocodilian head lunged forward, jaws open wide. Its footfalls were heavy and thunderous, shaking the earth beneath them. Reeking, carnivorous slaver dribbled from long, curving fangs. Small, deeply set eyes gleamed with a cold, nigh reptilian menace.

Kagura, looking fearfully over her shoulder, had only a single moment left to realize the futility of her flight. She may have been fast, may have been talented and athletic, but these things were nothing to a beast of this scale. The great, leathery, sinuous bulk of long, streamlined body rippled and bulged with powerful muscles, engines of force like bombs that went off beneath its pebbled, squamous hide.

Its sail was high in the air, eponymous bony spines fanning up from its back, connected from one to the next by a membranous veil of uncertain function.

The sneering maw of this great, primordial predator, the largest known theropod in the history of the world, a terror of primeval ancientry far beyond the reck of man. Here, she saw, in the surreal clarity of one who sees their own death coming, was something that could not be fathomed by mortal man. It was a remnant, a ghost, of some far off time, a spectral image of forgotten horror.

There was something fundamentally unnerving about this creature, something about these predatory members of dinosauria that was simply innately abhorrent to human sensibilities.

Dinosaurs and man were never meant to exist side by side. Millions of years separated them, whole eras of life dividing these two existences. Being put together like this, dinosaurs being brought back into this world to reign unchecked once again (if only on this island)...

It was folly. She was a fool to have come here, of course, but the greater fools yet were the ones who revived these monsters, who recreated them and set them loose upon this island.

Kagura felt a kind of serenity, a sort of profound peacefulness with these revelations, and with the understanding of what was going to happen. The fangs were about her, now, rows of serrated, dagger-like teeth lining up on either side of her tender, voluptuous form.

I wonder if it will hurt... was the last thought Kagura ever had. The jaws snapped close over her sensuous figure, teeth stabbing through her goodly breasts and straight through her heart. The spinosaur reared its head back, Kagura caught in its teeth, and shook its long, narrow side to side, powerful neck muscles driving the violent motion. The teeth piercing Kagura's body tore up her insides, shredding her sweet and savory viscera, pulping her innards and crushing many of her bones.

It was an easy, instant kill. Spinosaurus aegypticus was, by nature, a predator of smaller creatures. Fish, it preferred, but it would take down smaller terrestial prey as well. Humans were right within the size range of its preferred meals, and the spino gladly gobbled Kagura up.

She was dead before she even knew what happened, and the spinosaur then knocked its head back like a bird, letting gravity do the work of pulling Kagura's mangled, broken body down its gullet and into its esophagus. She would pass into its gizzard, where rough stones would grind her body down into a more digestible mass, providing the kind of deconstructive mastication which the spino's jaws were simply incapable of. And after that, the remains would go into its stomach, to be dissolved and eventually absorbed into its system through the intestines.

Kagura would provide the amphibious theropod with a modest level of sustenance. She would last it a good few hours, at the very least. Maybe even a whole day, if her curves were really as meaty as they looked.

Either way, she was gone. Kagura was nothing more than fuel for the engines of one of history's most formidable superpredators.

14322.content:
The low, whistling calls of her pursuers haunted Doctor Harding as she tumbled swiftly but frantically through the dense, tropic undergrowth. Anxiously, her hands searched the torn clothes barely clinging to her clothes for any remaining darts.

It was a futile task, she knew. Partly because the rifle's barrel had gotten fatally clogged with mud during Kelly's mortal tumble from the bike, and partly because the second she stopped to aim she would be dead meat.

The raptors were too fast for her to outrun on foot for long. In fact, from what she had observed of the speeds these animals could reach, and maintain, she should have been overtaken several times already. She was sure it wasn't because of her evasion skills that she survived still.

Sarah may have been experienced with beasts of the savanna, but in a new world jungle like this she was sorely out of her element. The damned branches kept snagging and tearing at the rips in her clothes from when---

No, she told herself, intensely focusing on maintaining her running speed. There's no point in looking back. He's dead. They're all dead. These creatures have killed them, dragged their bodies away. I'm the last one of us still alive.

And one way or another, I'll be the last one to die.

The yellowish-brown, ruddy-striped head of a juvenile raptor suddenly burst through the foilage just in front of Sarah. The bulk of the animal, individually not much more than a large dog, still seemed almost indomitably imposing, so near and close in front of her.

Adrenaline pumping through her system, her heartbeat thundering in her ears, Sarah grabbed the clogged, useless rifle. Instinctively, almost without even thinking, she swung the weapon in an overhand blow, striking the raptor squarely on the side of its head without even breaking her pace.

But did this desperate gambit work?
14322.title: Carnivore professional gets carnally vored

choices: A final spurt of strength, Sarah's last ditch effort at escape
Sarah Harding has nothing left to give, aside from her flesh
143222.content:
The raptor, juvenile or not, was clearly made of sturdier stuff than its size would suggest. Its head whipping back to the fore almost immediately, Sarah Harding only had a single, terrified moment to contemplate the gravity of her miscalculation.

Momentum carried her straight into the beast right as it pounced up into the air. It was too late to change her course.

The raptor's weight, the force of its leap, was concentrated into the tips of its sickle-like hind claws first. The talons were at chest level when Sarah collided with her erstwhile predator, and the sturdy, hardy scientist, even for all of her genuine strength and sturdiness in a pinch, simply could not challenge such a creature unarmed.

Not when more were right behind her.

Even as the first raptors hind claws tore excruciating into Sarah's modest breasts, ripping the supple flesh gruesomely, she could hear more coming up from behind. Even as she was knocked backwards, staggering for one or two seconds of horrified vulnerability, she could smell the rancid, sour odor of these creatures.

Then she landed on her back, the raptor atop her. The pain in her chest was intense beyond any real description, and in the corner of her eyes Sarah could see the bloody, mutilated mess of what were once her breasts as the curiously featherless dromaeosaurid dug its feet in.

More raptors darted forward, and they crowded all over and around Sarah. It was claustrophobic in the worst possible way. Their stench was overpowering, almost dizzying this close up, and the heat of their breath all but burned her skin.

They snapped indiscriminately at one another, no doubt fighting over which one would get the choicest parts. With a detached sort of weariness, Sarah noted that the raptors seemed to have very little social or hierarchical structure among themselves.

She could help but think how strange this was, for such obviously intelligent pack hunters. They were so quarrelsome and disorganized, like a bunch of children.

Well, in a way she supposed that was what they were.

Weakly, Sarah tried to fend off the bites as the raptors, now apparently having decided things, began snapping their heads forward to tear at her flesh. Her results were very mixed, considering that her hands were, to the raptors, as edible as any other part of her.

Sharp teeth ripped away the skin on Sarah's fingers. Blood poured from the wound, and the raptors continued to eat. Chunks the size of small apples, they tore out of the field researcher's muscular arms, and ones lower down began gnawing in earnest at her legs and feet.

Sarah was growing numb. Endorphines were flooding her body, dulling the pain, but she just didn't have anything left to give. She was much more fit and adept than most -- that was how she had lasted this long, fleeing the raptors when all of the others had been killed and eaten.

But even she was only human.

Weakly, she felt her arms fall down limply at her sides. One of the raptors, yellow gleaming eyes piercing for a split second into Sarah's own, leered at the scientist with a kind of cruel, bestial awareness, before ducking its head down to bite her neck.

What next?

choices: There are almost more gals to be gobbled up

Jaws with razor sharp teeth closed on Sarah's throat. She died. Then the raptors got a lot more eager in eating her.

Teeth ripped up her already torn tits. Fat, luscious woman-flesh slid down the gullets of the ravening raptors. They loved the taste of women especially, though only the oldest ones remembered what that tasted like. So soft and tender.

info.brief_description: People and characters get hunted and eaten by the dinos of Jurassic Park. Yum.
info.description:
Characters from your favorite series, or maybe characters made up solely for this thing, get hunted down and eaten by the dinosaurs of Jurassic Park.

If you are adding, P~L~E~A~S~E try to add chapters with ACTUAL CONTENT, and not merely choice chapters only a couple of sentences long. Also, I've seen interactives (or, at least one) where the dinosaurs are intelligent creatures that enslave and molest the characters.

For the love of God, don't do that here. The dinosaurs in this are animals. Hungry, rapacious, and maybe even lustful, I don't know. But, they are animals nonetheless. Even the velociraptors are at most as intelligent as chimpanzees. So, while I won't ask you to be ultra-accurate, at least try to keep it in the spirit of these creatures as ANIMALS hunting and eaten human (or not?) characters.

Relatedly, this means realistic-ish vore. No cock vore, anal vore, or unbirthing. Even soft vore should, ideally, only be done with dinos that are actually BIG ENOUGH to swallow humans alive (or whatever) alive.
